channel.title: Limit Starter to 1 per ip 742
channel.description: Sound's like a dumb question, but in settings i have this "MAX_STARTER_AMMOUNT = 1;" however even if i put it as 0 it still keeps giving me strarter's when i type in ::starter from a different account or talk to Eva, source is rune-evo 3

item.title: Limit Starter to 1 per ip 742
item.dc:creator: @gimpie gimpie
item.description:
@gimpie wrote:

[quote=“wetodded, post:7, topic:546610”]You need to add a type of IP tracker for the starter. It will check if that IP has had a starter, and if so, it doesn’t allow them to receive it. You could implement that in different ways to get around the starting part.

Here’s a link that explains it to an extent. The tutorial is for a different server, but the same mechanics apply.

http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/google/tutorials/253559-2-starters-per-ip-prevent-starter-xferring.html[/quote]

Sweet man! ill give it a try

EDIT: Rune-evo is already set up with a similar method, it dosnt use a connection class its all stored in player.java. the starter is set up with 3 styles to choose (range,mage and combat) wouldnt it be able to just support a logged ip file like you stated? how would i go about doing this?

Read full topic

item.title: Limit Starter to 1 per ip 742
item.dc:creator: @wetodded wetodded
item.description:
@wetodded wrote:

You need to add a type of IP tracker for the starter. It will check if that IP has had a starter, and if so, it doesn’t allow them to receive it. You could implement that in different ways to get around the starting part.

Here’s a link that explains it to an extent. The tutorial is for a different server, but the same mechanics apply.

http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-server/tutorials/253559-2-starters-per-ip-prevent-starter-xferring.html

Read full topic

item.title: Limit Starter to 1 per ip 742
item.dc:creator: @gimpie gimpie
item.description:
@gimpie wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:5, topic:546610”]A good place to start for us to help you more is by posting your starter command. The start command could be calling a method like getStarter() or it could just look like this…

addItem(995, 1000);
addItem(2341, 1);

But basically what you want to do is that after someone has received a starter, set that value in their player files, I wouldn’t doubt there is already

characterStarter = 0;

in the player files. Basically within the command you just make an if statement…

if(characterStarter = 1) {
 sendMessage("You have already gotten a starter");
} else {
addItem(995, 1000);
addItem(3425, 1000);
...
...
sendMessage("You have received your starter! Thanks.");
characterStarter = 1;
}

The code above will not work, it’s just a mock up.

I can tell you what to do more in-depth if you post your ::starter command. Thanks.

EDIT
I didn’t realize you wanted only one per IP. For this, when someone claims a starter, save it to a text file that this IP has gotten a starter. Once again though, post your command.[/quote]

Thanks web guy, here’s my starter class [code]package com.rs.game.player.dialogues.impl;

import com.rs.game.Graphics;
import com.rs.game.WorldTile;
import com.rs.game.minigames.CastleWars;
import com.rs.game.player.Inventory;
import com.rs.game.player.Skills;
import com.rs.game.player.actions.DonatorActions;
import com.rs.game.player.actions.ShipTravelAction;
import com.rs.game.player.content.Magic;
import com.rs.game.player.content.cities.tzhaar.LavaMine;
import com.rs.game.player.content.custom.StarterItems;
import com.rs.game.player.content.interfaces.WelcomeBook;
import com.rs.game.player.controlers.FightCaves;
import com.rs.game.player.controlers.FightKiln;
import com.rs.game.player.controlers.NomadsRequiem;
import com.rs.game.player.dialogues.Dialogue;

// Referenced classes of package com.rs.game.player.dialogues:
// Dialogue

public class Starter extends Dialogue {

public Starter() {
}

@Override
public void start() {
	stage = 1;
	sendOptionsDialogue("Pick a Starter Type", 
			"I would like a Fighter's Starter",
			"I would like an Archer's Starter",
			"I would like a Magician's Starter");

}

@Override
public void run(int interfaceId, int componentId) {
	if (stage == 1) {
		if (componentId == OPTION_1) {
			StarterItems.giveStarter(player, StarterItems.FIGHTER);
			player.unlock();
			WelcomeBook.openRules(player);
		} else if (componentId == OPTION_2) {
			StarterItems.giveStarter(player, StarterItems.ARCHER);
			player.unlock();
			WelcomeBook.openRules(player);
		} else if (componentId == OPTION_3) {
			StarterItems.giveStarter(player, StarterItems.MAGICIAN);
			player.unlock();
			WelcomeBook.openRules(player);

		} 
	}
}

@Override
public void finish() {
}

}
[/code] Here is my ::starter command if (cmd[0].equals("starter")) { if (player.getClassName() == "" || player.getClassName() == null) { player.getDialogueManager().startDialogue("starter"); return true; } player.sendMessage("You've already selected a starter!"); return true; }and also heres my newstarter class (i disabled this because people could constantly keep farming starters right off the bat on different accounts, for some reason ::starter dosnt work and wont open the dialogue when its typed in so bassicaly because i removed this sequence from the player class people cant get starter’s at all until i fix this XD) [code]package com.rs.game.player.dialogues.impl;

import com.rs.game.player.content.custom.StarterItems;
import com.rs.game.player.dialogues.Dialogue;

public class NewStarter extends Dialogue {

int starter;
int difficulty;

@Override
public void start() {
	stage = 1;
	sendEntityDialogue(IS_NPC, "Lucy", 13768, 9827, 
		"Welcome to Epicac icecreamscape, "+player.getDisplayName()+"!",
		"Please, before you begin you will need", 
		"choose your starter set and your difficulty.",
		"You may change your difficulty at a later time.");
}

@Override
public void run(int interfaceId, int componentId) {
	
	if (player.getInterfaceManager().containsScreenInter()) {
		player.getInterfaceManager().closeScreenInterface();
	}
	
	if (stage == 1) {
		sendOptionsDialogue("Pick a Starter Type",
				"I would like a Fighter's Starter",
				"I would like an Archer's Starter",
				"I would like a Magician's Starter");
		stage = 2;
	} else if (stage == 2) {
		if (componentId == OPTION_1) {
			this.starter = StarterItems.FIGHTER;
			sendNext_1();
		} else if (componentId == OPTION_2) {
			this.starter = StarterItems.ARCHER;
			sendNext_1();
		}else if (componentId == OPTION_3) {
			this.starter = StarterItems.MAGICIAN;
			sendNext_1();
		}
	} else if (stage == 3) {
		sendOptionsDialogue("Select an Option", 
				"Normal",
				"Hard");
		stage = 4;
	} else if (stage == 4) {
		if (componentId == OPTION_1) {
			this.difficulty = 1;
			sendNext_2();
		} else if (componentId == OPTION_2) {
			this.difficulty = 2;
			sendNext_2();
		} else if (componentId == OPTION_3) {
			this.difficulty = 3;
			sendNext_2();
		} else if (componentId == OPTION_4) {
			this.difficulty = 4;
			sendNext_2();
		} else if (componentId == OPTION_5) {
			this.difficulty = 5;
			sendNext_2();
		}
	} else if (stage == 5) {
		player.setDifficulty(difficulty);
		StarterItems.giveStarter(player, starter);
	}
}

public void sendNext_1() {
	sendEntityDialogue(IS_NPC, "Lucy", 13768, 9827, 
			"Very good! Now all you need to do is select",
			"your difficulty. Please keep in mind that harder", 
			"difficulties have low exp, but have better drops",
			"while lower difficulties are the opposite!");
	stage = 3;
}

public void sendNext_2() {
	sendEntityDialogue(IS_NPC, "Lucy", 13768, 9827, 
			"Very good! You've chosen to play on "+diffs[difficulty - 1]+",",
			"Now what are you waiting for? Go out and have some fun!", 
			"Just click the button below and everything will",
			"be given to you! We hope you enjoy your stay!");
	stage = 5;
}

public static String[] diffs = {"Normal", "Hard"};

@Override
public void finish() {
	// TODO Auto-generated method stub
	
}

}[/code] Im not 100% what the issuee even is but inorder to stop my beta testers from spawning endless ammounts of starters i had to disable it.

Read full topic

item.title: Limit Starter to 1 per ip 742
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

A good place to start for us to help you more is by posting your starter command. The start command could be calling a method like getStarter() or it could just look like this…

addItem(995, 1000);
addItem(2341, 1);

But basically what you want to do is that after someone has received a starter, set that value in their player files, I wouldn’t doubt there is already

characterStarter = 0;

in the player files. Basically within the command you just make an if statement…

if(characterStarter = 1) {
 sendMessage("You have already gotten a starter");
} else {
addItem(995, 1000);
addItem(3425, 1000);
...
...
sendMessage("You have received your starter! Thanks.");
characterStarter = 1;
}

The code above will not work, it’s just a mock up.

I can tell you what to do more in-depth if you post your ::starter command. Thanks.

EDIT
I didn’t realize you wanted only one per IP. For this, when someone claims a starter, save it to a text file that this IP has gotten a starter. Once again though, post your command.

Read full topic

item.title: Limit Starter to 1 per ip 742
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“gimpie, post:3, topic:546610”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=665506.msg4449006#msg4449006 date=1410300575]
Then find the code that calls that constant and reverse engineer it from there.
[/quote]
Could you specify where exactly that would be? ive searched everwhere in my starter classes and have had no luck whats so ever[/quote]
Not a clue, keep looking. It’s possible that the constant isn’t being used at all. I’d start with whatever class sends the client all the players information on log-in, f.e. in Hyperion this class is “ActionSender”.

Read full topic
